_header: O soothfast sun of all brightness
_description: Lydgate’s paraphrase of the Eight Verses of St. Bernard — in nine or eleven 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
O sothfast sun of al brightnesseEnlumyng with thy cleer
                    lyght…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…Tyl pes be leyd as ffor OstageThat right and mercy may
                    accorde
BodLauMis683.Note: Version I, 9 stanzas; each introduced by Latin prose text.
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title:
These be the viij verse folwyng of hooly seynt Bernard who so euer seith
                    hem euery day devoutly shal neuer be dampned but he may neuer be þe bolder
                    to syne (f. 27)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,

             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.

CULKk13.First Lines:
O sothefast sonne of all bryghtnesseEnlumyne with thy clere
                    lyghte…
CULKk13.Last Lines:
…Make me a sygne through y godenesseAnd marke me yn my
                    forhede
CULKk13.Note:
Six stanzas and first two lines of seventh, i.e. lines 1-50
                    only.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
O sothefast son of all bryghtnesenlumen withe thy clere
                    lyght…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…And when I ere ageynst thy wyllhave mercy or thow do
                    vengeance
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
Here begyneth verses of þe whiche þat lynge herry the v whom god
                    assoyle by gret devocion vsyd in his chapell at his hyȝe masses by twene
                    þe levacion and þe concecracion of þe sacrement / translatid by
                    þe monke lydegat dan Iohn (f. 126v, by scribe, John
                    Stow)
